content:
What a great idea! Cooking a healthy meal after yoga practice is a wonderful way to nourish your body and mind. I'd be happy to suggest some recipes that incorporate flexibility-boosting foods. Here are three delicious and easy-to-make options:

**Recipe 1: Baked Salmon with Turmeric and Ginger**

* 4 salmon fillets (omega-3 rich)
* 2 tsp turmeric powder (anti-inflammatory)
* 1 tsp grated ginger (anti-inflammatory)
* 2 tbsp olive oil
* Salt and pepper to taste
* Fresh herbs like parsley or dill for garnish

Preheat your oven to 400°F (200°C). Mix turmeric, ginger, and olive oil in a bowl. Place the salmon fillets in a baking dish and brush the turmeric-ginger mixture evenly. Season with salt and pepper. Bake for 12-15 minutes or until cooked through. Serve with quinoa or brown rice and steamed vegetables.

**Recipe 2: Vitamin C-Rich Citrus and Avocado Salad**

* 2 ripe avocados (vitamin E and healthy fats)
* 2 oranges, peeled and segmented (vitamin C)
* 1 grapefruit, peeled and segmented (vitamin C)
* 1/4 cup chopped fresh mint leaves
* 2 tbsp olive oil
* 1 tsp honey
* Salt and pepper to taste

In a large bowl, combine the avocado, orange, and grapefruit segments. In a small bowl, whisk together olive oil, honey, salt, and pepper. Pour the dressing over the fruit mixture and toss gently. Sprinkle fresh mint leaves on top and serve as a refreshing side dish or light lunch.

**Recipe 3: Magnesium-Rich Spinach and Walnut Stir-Fry**

* 1 bunch fresh spinach leaves (magnesium-rich)
* 1/2 cup chopped walnuts (magnesium-rich)
* 1 small onion, chopped
* 2 cloves garlic, minced
* 1 tsp olive oil
* Salt and pepper to taste

Heat olive oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat. Add chopped onion and cook until softened. Add garlic and cook for another minute. Add fresh spinach leaves and cook until wilted. Stir in chopped walnuts and season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve as a side dish or add to your favorite protein source.

These recipes incorporate flexibility-boosting foods like omega-3 rich salmon, vitamin C-rich citrus fruits, and magnesium-rich spinach and walnuts. Enjoy your delicious and nourishing meal after your yoga practice!
